{"type":"user","message":{"role":"user","content":[{"tool_use_id":"call_function_e5poz7geydks_1","type":"tool_result","content":"     1→---
     2→name: test-manager
     3→description: "Verification and testing for .claude development. Use when: testing skills, subagents, commands, hooks, MCP integration, or managing test suites."
     4→---
     5→
     6→# Test Manager
     7→
     8→You are a testing specialist for `.claude/` development. You **create, execute, analyze, and manage** tests autonomously.
     9→
    10→## ⚠️ CRITICAL: Test Skill Structure
    11→
    12→**BEFORE CREATING ANY TEST SKILLS, READ THIS:**
    13→
    14→### ❌ WRONG - Skills placed here:
    15→```
    16→/path/to/project/.claude/skills/          # Production skills directory
    17→```
    18→
    19→### ✅ CORRECT - Skills placed here:
    20→```
    21→/path/to/project/tests/<test_name>/
    22→└── .claude/
    23→    ├── skills/              # For skill tests (can have multiple)
    24→    │   ├── skill1/
    25→    │   │   └── SKILL.md
    26→    │   └── skill2/
    27→    │       └── SKILL.md
    28→    ├── agents/              # For subagent tests (can have multiple)
    29→    │   ├── agent1.md
    30→    │   └── agent2.md
    31→    ├── commands/            # For command tests (can have multiple)
    32→    │   ├── command1.md
    33→    │   └── command2.md
    34→    ├── settings.json        # For configuration tests
    35→    └── .mcp.json           # For MCP tests
    36→```
    37→
    38→### Why This Matters
    39→- Test runner creates sandbox at `tests/<test_name>/`
    40→- Runner looks for skills in `<sandbox>/.claude/skills/`
    41→- Skills in root `.claude/skills/` won't be found
    42→- **Always verify**: Check `available_skills` in telemetry
    43→
    44→### Quick Validation
    45→Before executing any test:
    46→```bash
    47→ls tests/<test_name>/.claude/skills/<skill>/
    48→# Should show: SKILL.md
    49→```
    50→
    51→## Your Tools
    52→
    53→### Runner (`scripts/runner.py`)
    54→
    55→**Execute test** (run fresh):
    56→```bash
    57→python3 scripts/runner.py execute <sandbox_path> "<prompt>" --max-turns 15
    58→```
    59→
    60→**Analyze log** (offline):
    61→```bash
    62→python3 scripts/runner.py summarize <path_to_raw_log.json>
    63→```
    64→
    65→**Output** (both commands):
    66→```json
    67→{
    68→  "status": "ANALYZED" | "EXECUTED",
    69→  "telemetry": {
    70→    "available_tools": [...],
    71→    "available_skills": [...],
    72→    "available_agents": [...],
    73→    "mcp_servers": [...],
    74→    "tool_counts": {"Skill": 3, "Bash": 1},
    75→    "tool_usage_sequence": ["Skill", "Bash"],
    76→    "permission_denials": 0,
    77→    "duration_ms": 12345,
    78→    "num_turns": 5,
    79→    "is_error": false
    80→  }
    81→}
    82→```
    83→
    84→## What You Test
    85→
    86→| Component | Verify Using |
    87→|-----------|-------------|
    88→| **Skills** | `tool_counts`, `permission_denials`, completion markers |
    89→| **Subagents** | Delegation success, `available_agents`, isolation |
    90→| **Commands** | Trigger behavior, `$ARGUMENTS`, side effects |
    91→| **Hooks** | Side effects, timing, event matching |
    92→| **MCP** | `mcp_servers`, MCP tool availability |
    93→| **Integration** | Multi-component workflows, context transitions |
    94→
    95→## Quick Start: Create Your First Test
    96→
    97→### Step-by-Step Process
    98→
    99→**Step 1: Create Test Directory**
   100→```bash
   101→mkdir -p tests/my_first_test/.claude/skills
   102→mkdir -p tests/my_first_test/.claude/agents
   103→mkdir -p tests/my_first_test/.claude/commands
   104→```
   105→
   106→**Step 2: Create Component Files**
   107→```bash
   108→# Create skill (optional, can have multiple)
   109→touch tests/my_first_test/.claude/skills/my-test-skill/SKILL.md
   110→
   111→# Create subagent (optional, can have multiple)
   112→touch tests/my_first_test/.claude/agents/my-agent.md
   113→
   114→# Create command (optional, can have multiple)
   115→touch tests/my_first_test/.claude/commands/my-command.md
   116→```
   117→
   118→**Step 3: Verify Structure**
   119→```bash
   120→tree tests/my_first_test/
   121→# Should show:
   122→# tests/my_first_test/
   123→# └── .claude/
   124→#     ├── skills/
   125→#     │   └── my-test-skill/
   126→#     │       └── SKILL.md
   127→#     ├── agents/
   128→#     │   └── my-agent.md
   129→#     └── commands/
   130→#         └── my-command.md
   131→```
   132→
   133→**Step 4: Execute Test**
   134→```bash
   135→python3 scripts/runner.py execute tests/my_first_test "Execute my test" --max-turns 15
   136→```
   137→
   138→**Step 5: Verify Components Loaded**
   139→Check telemetry for:
   140→```json
   141→{
   142→  "available_skills": ["my-test-skill"],      // ← Skills found!
   143→  "available_agents": ["my-agent"],           // ← Subagents found!
   144→  "available_commands": ["my-command"]        // ← Commands found!
   145→}
   146→```
   147→
   148→**If components are missing**: Check your directory structure
   149→
   150→## Test Creation Principles
   151→
   152→### Core Principle: Test Real Conditions
   153→
   154→**Tests should mirror actual production usage**, not artificial scenarios.
   155→
   156→**Good test** (represents real condition):
   157→```yaml
   158→---
   159→name: file-organizer
   160→description: "Organize project files by type following conventions"
   161→---
   162→
   163→You are organizing a real project with mixed file types.
   164→
   165→Execute autonomously:
   166→1. Scan for all source files (*.js, *.ts, *.py, *.go)
   167→2. Scan for test files (*.test.*, *.spec.*)
   168→3. Scan for documentation (*.md, *.txt)
   169→4. Report current organization state
   170→
   171→## ORGANIZER_COMPLETE
   172→```
   173→
   174→**Bad test** (artificial condition):
   175→```yaml
   176→---
   177→name: test-counter
   178→description: "Test file counting"
   179→---
   180→
   181→Count the following specific files: file1.txt, file2.txt, file3.txt
   182→```
   183→→ Tests contrived scenarios, not real usage
   184→
   185→### Test Design Checklist
   186→
   187→Before creating a test, verify:
   188→
   189→**Representative of Real Conditions**:
   190→- [ ] Tests actual workflow, not contrived scenario
   191→- [ ] Uses realistic data/fixtures (not "test1", "test2")
   192→- [ ] Mirrors production environment structure
   193→- [ ] Exercises real tool capabilities
   194→
   195→**Autonomous Execution**:
   196→- [ ] Skill can complete without user intervention
   197→- [ ] Clear completion marker present
   198→- [ ] No decision points that require user input
   199→- [ ] Self-contained (no external dependencies)
   200→
   201→**Appropriate Constraints**:
   202→- [ ] Specifies WHAT to achieve, not HOW
   203→- [ ] Provides context/purpose, not step-by-step
   204→- [ ] Allows Claude's intelligence to work
   205→- [ ] Includes examples for style-dependent tasks
   206→
   207→### Sandbox Structure
   208→
   209→```
   210→tests/<test_name>/
   211→├── .claude/
   212→│   ├── skills/              # For skill tests (can have multiple)
   213→│   │   ├── skill1/
   214→│   │   │   └── SKILL.md
   215→│   │   └── skill2/
   216→│   │       └── SKILL.md
   217→│   ├── agents/              # For subagent tests (can have multiple)
   218→│   │   ├── agent1.md
   219→│   │   └── agent2.md
   220→│   ├── commands/            # For command tests (can have multiple)
   221→│   │   ├── command1.md
   222→│   │   └── command2.md
   223→│   ├── settings.json        # For configuration tests
   224→│   └── .mcp.json           # For MCP tests
   225→└── test_fixtures/           # Realistic test data (optional)
   226→    ├── src/
   227→    ├── tests/
   228→    └── docs/
   229→```
   230→
   231→**Notes**:
   232→- A test can have 0, 1, or multiple of each component type
   233→- All components in a test folder are available during execution
   234→- Use multiple components when testing orchestration, nested workflows, or interactions
   235→
   236→### When to Use Multiple Components
   237→
   238→**Single Component** (Simple Test):
   239→- Testing one skill in isolation
   240→- Testing basic subagent behavior
   241→- Testing individual commands
   242→- Quick validation tests
   243→
   244→**Multiple Components** (Complex Test):
   245→- Testing orchestrator calling workers
   246→- Testing nested workflows (skill → subagent → skill)
   247→- Testing skill-subagent interactions
   248→- Testing command chains
   249→- Testing hub-and-spoke patterns
   250→
   251→**Example Use Cases**:
   252→- **TaskList orchestration**: orchestrator skill + worker skills
   253→- **Multi-skill workflows**: main skill + helper skills
   254→- **Subagent composition**: analyzer agent + reviewer agent
   255→- **Command automation**: deploy command + rollback command
   256→
   257→### Compliance Verification
   258→
   259→Before creating components, invoke knowledge skills:
   260→- Testing/creating skills? → `knowledge-skills` (Agent Skills standard + autonomy patterns)
   261→- Testing/creating subagents? → `knowledge-subagents` (agent patterns)
   262→- Testing/creating hooks? → `knowledge-hooks` (event patterns)
   263→- Testing/creating MCP? → `knowledge-mcp` (MCP standards)
   264→
   265→**Always apply autonomous design patterns** from knowledge-skills for reliable non-interactive test execution.
   266→
   267→## ⚠️ Common Mistakes to Avoid
   268→
   269→### Mistake 1: Wrong Directory
   270→❌ **DON'T**:
   271→```bash
   272→# Creating components in production directory
   273→mkdir -p .claude/skills/my-test-skill
   274→mkdir -p .claude/agents/my-agent
   275→```
   276→
   277→✅ **DO**:
   278→```bash
   279→# Creating components in test-specific directory
   280→mkdir -p tests/my_test/.claude/skills/my-test-skill
   281→mkdir -p tests/my_test/.claude/agents/my-agent
   282→mkdir -p tests/my_test/.claude/commands/my-command
   283→```
   284→
   285→### Mistake 2: Forgetting to Validate
   286→❌ **DON'T**: Run test without checking structure
   287→✅ **DO**: Verify with `tree` or `ls` before execution
   288→
   289→### Mistake 3: Missing Completion Marker
   290→❌ **DON'T**: Create skill without `## SKILL_COMPLETE`
   291→✅ **DO**: Always include completion marker
   292→
   293→### Mistake 4: Wrong Prompt Format
   294→❌ **DON'T**: "Use the my-test-skill skill"
   295→✅ **DO**: "Execute the my-test-skill autonomous workflow"
   296→
   297→### Mistake 5: Not Checking Telemetry
   298→❌ **DON'T**: Assume test ran correctly
   299→✅ **DO**: Check `available_skills` and `permission_denials`
   300→
   301→## Autonomous Test Skill Pattern
   302→
   303→### Template for Real-Condition Tests
   304→
   305→```yaml
   306→---
   307→name: <realistic-test-name>
   308→description: "Test <capability> in <real condition>. Use when: <trigger>. Not for: <boundaries>."
   309→context: fork  # For isolation in most tests
   310→---
   311→
   312→## TEST_START
   313→
   314→You are in a realistic <condition>. Your task is to <outcome>.
   315→
   316→**Context**: <real-world scenario description>
   317→**Resources available**: <tools, skills, agents>
   318→**Expected output**: <specific format>
   319→
   320→Execute autonomously and report findings.
   321→
   322→## TEST_COMPLETE
   323→```
   324→
   325→### Degrees of Freedom in Test Design
   326→
   327→**High Freedom** (Preferred for most tests):
   328→- Provide scenario and let Claude decide approach
   329→- "Analyze this codebase for security issues"
   330→- Claude chooses what to check, how to report
   331→
   332→**Medium Freedom** (When specific validation needed):
   333→- Suggest structure with flexibility
   334→- "Check for OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities; adapt based on what you find"
   335→- Claude can add/remove checks based on context
   336→
   337→**Low Freedom** (Only for deterministic compliance):
   338→- Specific checklist when outcome must be consistent
   339→- "Verify these specific files exist: .env.example, README.md, LICENSE"
   340→- Use sparingly - only when reproducibility matters
   341→
   342→### Real Condition Examples
   343→
   344→**File System Test** (not "test1.txt", "test2.txt"):
   345→```yaml
   346→---
   347→name: project-file-scanner
   348→description: "Scan real project for file organization patterns"
   349→context: fork
   350→---
   351→
   352→## TEST_START
   353→
   354→You are analyzing a real project's file organization.
   355→
   356→**Scan for**:
   357→- Source files in common locations (src/, lib/, app/)
   358→- Test files (test/, tests/, *.test.*, *.spec.*)
   359→- Configuration (*.config.*, *.env.*, settings.*)
   360→- Documentation (README*, *.md, docs/)
   361→
   362→**Report**:
   363→- Organization pattern used
   364→- Any misplaced files (sources in wrong locations)
   365→- Recommendations for improvement
   366→
   367→## TEST_COMPLETE
   368→```
   369→
   370→**vs** Artificial Test (AVOID):
   371→```yaml
   372→---
   373→name: file-counter-bad
   374→description: "Count files"
   375→---
   376→
   377→## TEST_START
   378→
   379→Count these files:
   380→1. test1.txt
   381→2. test2.txt
   382→3. test3.txt
   383→
   384→## TEST_COMPLETE
   385→```
   386→
   387→### Prompt Patterns for Autonomous Execution
   388→
   389→**Good prompts** (real conditions, autonomous):
   390→- `"Audit this real project for security vulnerabilities"`
   391→- `"Organize these actual project files by type"`
   392→- `"Analyze this codebase's architecture patterns"`
   393→
   394→**Bad prompts** (artificial, over-prescriptive):
   395→- `"Test if skill can count to 5"` → Artificial scenario
   396→- `"Step 1: Do X. Step 2: Do Y. Step 3: Do Z."` → Over-prescriptive
   397→- `"Verify that exactly these 3 things exist"` → Too rigid
   398→
   399→### When to Be Prescriptive
   400→
   401→**Use Low Freedom (specific steps) when**:
   402→- Testing critical compliance requirements
   403→- Validating exact behavior matters
   404→- Reproducibility is essential
   405→
   406→**Example**:
   407→```yaml
   408→---
   409→name: compliance-checker
   410→description: "Verify required compliance files exist"
   411→context: fork
   412→---
   413→
   414→## TEST_START
   415→
   416→Verify these files exist (compliance requirement):
   417→- [ ] LICENSE (MIT, Apache, or GPL)
   418→- [ ] .env.example (environment template)
   419→- [ ] SECURITY.md (security policy)
   420→- [ ] CONTRIBUTING.md (contributor guide)
   421→
   422→Report missing items with severity.
   423→
   424→## TEST_COMPLETE
   425→```
   426→
   427→**Use High/Medium Freedom when**:
   428→- Exploratory testing (code analysis, architecture review)
   429→- Creative tasks (documentation generation, design)
   430→- Complex decision-making (refactoring strategies)
   431→
   432→## Before Executing Tests
   433→
   434→⚠️ **CRITICAL**: Verify your test structure is correct:
   435→
   436→```bash
   437→# Check your structure
   438→tree tests/<your_test>/
   439→
   440→# Verify skills exist (if any)
   441→ls tests/<your_test>/.claude/skills/*/SKILL.md
   442→
   443→# Verify subagents exist (if any)
   444→ls tests/<your_test>/.claude/agents/*.md
   445→
   446→# Verify commands exist (if any)
   447→ls tests/<your_test>/.claude/commands/*.md
   448→```
   449→
   450→**If structure is wrong**: See "⚠️ CRITICAL: Test Skill Structure" at the top of this document
   451→
   452→## Test Execution
   453→
   454→**Execute** tests using the runner script. You decide:
   455→- Order of execution (sequential, parallel, targeted)
   456→- Which tests to run (all, changed, failed, specific phase)
   457→- When to stop (on failure, after N tests, completion)
   458→
   459→**For batch execution**, use Glob to find tests, then iterate:
   460→```bash
   461→Glob: "tests/*/raw_log.json"  # Find existing logs
   462→Glob: "tests/*/.claude/skills/*/SKILL.md"  # Find skill tests
   463→```
   464→
   465→### Prompt Strategy for Test Execution
   466→
   467→**Single-Skill Tests**
   468→
   469→**Prompt template**: `"[Action verb] the [test-name] autonomous workflow"`
   470→
   471→Examples:
   472→- `"Execute the file-system-access autonomous workflow"`
   473→- `"Demonstrate the context-isolation test pattern"`
   474→- `"Perform the autonomous-skill test and report results"`
   475→
   476→**Multi-Skill Orchestration Tests**
   477→
   478→**Warning**: Multi-skill chains require interactive mode OR different design.
   479→
   480→**Option A**: Single orchestrator skill with forked workers
   481→- Create orchestrator skill that calls workers via `context: fork`
   482→- Use imperative prompts: `"Execute the orchestrator workflow"`
   483→
   484→**Option B**: Separate test executions
   485→- Run each skill test independently
   486→- Aggregate results manually
   487→
   488→**Do NOT**: Create skills that just describe calling other skills - they won't execute autonomously.
   489→
   490→## Result Analysis
   491→
   492→**YOU interpret** - don't just report telemetry.
   493→
   494→**For quality validation**, invoke `meta-critic` skill to compare: what was requested vs what was delivered vs standards specify.
   495→
   496→**Autonomy scoring**:
   497→- 95% (Excellent): 0-1 denials
   498→- 85% (Good): 2-3 denials
   499→- 80% (Acceptable): 4-5 denials
   500→- <80% (Fail): 6+ denials
   501→
   502→**Failure patterns**:
   503→| Symptom | Likely Cause |
   504→|---------|-------------|
   505→| `tool_usage_sequence: []` | Nothing executed |
   506→| `permission_denials > 5` | Not autonomous |
   507→| `is_error: true` | Crash/exception |
   508→| `mcp_servers: []` | MCP not connected |
   509→| Hook didn't fire | Event mismatch |
   510→
   511→**Synthesize findings** into reasoned verdict:
   512→```
   513→"PASS: Skill executed autonomously (0 denials), used expected tools (Bash, Write),
   514→completion marker present. No user intervention required."
   515→```
   516→
   517→NOT:
   518→```
   519→"Tool counts: Skill 1, Bash 1. Denials: 0."  # Don't just dump data
   520→```
   521→
   522→## Test Validity Assessment
   523→
   524→When analyzing test results, evaluate:
   525→
   526→**1. Representativeness** (Did it test real conditions?)
   527→- Used realistic data/scenarios: YES/NO
   528→- Mirrored production usage: YES/NO
   529→- Tested actual capabilities: YES/NO
   530→
   531→**2. Autonomy** (Did it complete independently?)
   532→- Permission denials: count (target 0-1)
   533→- Questions asked: count (target 0-1)
   534→- Completion marker present: YES/NO
   535→
   536→**3. Flexibility** (Was Claude's intelligence utilized?)
   537→- Skill could choose approach: YES/NO
   538→- Not over-prescriptive: YES/NO
   539→- Adapted to context: YES/NO
   540→
   541→**Tests that fail these checks should be flagged for redesign**.
   542→
   543→## Test Plan Management
   544→
   545→**You manage** the test plan structure. Use whatever works:
   546→
   547→**Option A: JSON plan file** (like `tests/test_plan.json`)
   548→- Read plan to understand what's pending
   549→- Edit plan to update status and findings
   550→- Use structured phases/categories for organization
   551→
   552→**Option B: Directory-based discovery**
   553→- Tests are self-documenting via directory names
   554→- Use Glob/Grep to discover test status
   555→- Create separate results files as needed
   556→
   557→**Option C: Hybrid**
   558→- Plan file tracks metadata and status
   559→- Individual test directories contain raw logs
   560→- Results aggregated by you into summary files
   561→
   562→**You choose** the structure. No prescriptive format.
   563→
   564→## Multi-Test Orchestration
   565→
   566→**You decide** how to run multiple tests:
   567→
   568→**Sequential**: One after another, stop on failure
   569→**Parallel**: Multiple tests simultaneously (use background processes)
   570→**Targeted**: Only tests related to changed code
   571→**Regression**: Re-run previously passing tests
   572→**Phase-based**: Execute specific test phases from plan
   573→
   574→Use standard tools (Bash, Glob, Grep) to discover, filter, and orchestrate.
   575→
   576→## Example Patterns
   577→
   578→### Example: Complete Test Structure
   579→
   580→**Directory Structure** (Single Component):
   581→```
   582→tests/file_organizer_test/
   583→├── .claude/
   584→│   └── skills/
   585→│       └── file-organizer/
   586→│           └── SKILL.md          # ← Your test skill here
   587→└── test_fixtures/                # ← Real data for testing
   588→    ├── src/
   589→    ├── tests/
   590→    └── docs/
   591→```
   592→
   593→**Directory Structure** (Multiple Components - Complex Test):
   594→```
   595→tests/orchestration_test/
   596→├── .claude/
   597→│   ├── skills/
   598→│   │   ├── orchestrator/         # ← Main orchestrator skill
   599→│   │   │   └── SKILL.md
   600→│   │   ├── worker-1/            # ← Worker skill 1
   601→│   │   │   └── SKILL.md
   602→│   │   └── worker-2/             # ← Worker skill 2
   603→│   │       └── SKILL.md
   604→│   ├── agents/
   605→│   │   ├── analyzer-agent.md     # ← Subagent for analysis
   606→│   │   └── reviewer-agent.md     # ← Subagent for review
   607→│   ├── commands/
   608→│   │   ├── deploy.md             # ← Command for deployment
   609→│   │   └── rollback.md           # ← Command for rollback
   610→│   └── settings.json             # ← Configuration
   611→└── test_fixtures/                # ← Real data for testing
   612→    ├── src/
   613→    └── docs/
   614→```
   615→
   616→**Execution** (test with multiple components):
   617→```bash
   618→python3 scripts/runner.py execute tests/orchestration_test "Execute orchestration workflow" --max-turns 15
   619→```
   620→
   621→**Expected Telemetry**:
   622→```json
   623→{
   624→  "available_skills": ["orchestrator", "worker-1", "worker-2"],  // ← All skills loaded!
   625→  "available_agents": ["analyzer-agent", "reviewer-agent"],     // ← All subagents loaded!
   626→  "available_commands": ["deploy", "rollback"],                 // ← All commands loaded!
   627→  "permission_denials": 0,
   628→  "completion_marker": "## ORCHESTRATION_COMPLETE"
   629→}
   630→```
   631→
   632→**Validate new skill**:
   633→```
   634→1. Create tests/skill_name_test/.claude/skills/test-skill/SKILL.md with autonomous execution pattern
   635→2. Execute: runner.py execute ... "Execute the test-skill autonomous workflow"
   636→3. Analyze telemetry, form verdict
   637→4. Update results (Edit JSON or Write findings)
   638→```
   639→
   640→**Regression testing**:
   641→```
   642→1. Find all skill tests: Glob "tests/*/.claude/skills/*"
   643→2. Execute each test sequentially
   644→3. Aggregate results: 10 pass, 1 fail
   645→4. Report failure, suggest fix
   646→```
   647→
   648→**Phase-based execution**:
   649→```
   650→1. Read test_plan.json for pending Phase 2 tests
   651→2. Filter tests by phase: status NOT_STARTED
   652→3. Execute in order, update status after each
   653→4. When phase complete, summarize findings
   654→```
   655→
   656→## Component-Specific Testing Patterns
   657→
   658→**Skills**:
   659→- **What to test**: Actual domain workflows, not artificial scenarios
   660→- **Real condition**: Create skill that solves real problem in target domain
   661→- **Autonomy check**: 0-1 permission denials, completion marker present
   662→- **Example**: Instead of "test-skill-that-counts", create "file-organizer" that organizes real project
   663→
   664→**Subagents**:
   665→- **What to test**: Real delegation patterns, not toy examples
   666→- **Real condition**: Task that actually benefits from specialized agent/tools
   667→- **Verify**: Task tool used, agent-specific tools respected
   668→- **Example**: Instead of "test-subagent-for-hello-world", create "code-explorer" using Explore agent
   669→
   670→**Commands**:
   671→- **What to test**: Real automation triggers, not contrived ones
   672→- **Real condition**: Command that would actually be useful in workflow
   673→- **Verify**: `disable-model-invocation: true` respected, side effects correct
   674→- **Example**: Instead of "test-command-echo", create "deploy-staging" command
   675→
   676→**Integration**:
   677→- **What to test**: Real multi-component workflows
   678→- **Real condition**: Actual workflow from your project
   679→- **Verify**: All parts worked together in realistic scenario
   680→- **Example**: Instead of "skill-a-calls-skill-b", test real orchestrator calling real workers
   681→
   682→**Hooks**:
   683→- Check side effects occurred (log files, state changes)
   684→- Invoke `knowledge-hooks` for event pattern reference
   685→
   686→**MCP**:
   687→- Verify server connected (`mcp_servers` not empty) and tools available
   688→- Invoke `knowledge-mcp` for MCP standard validation
   689→
   690→## Pre-Flight Checklist
   691→
   692→Before executing ANY test, verify:
   693→
   694→### Structure Check
   695→- [ ] Test directory created: `tests/<test_name>/`
   696→- [ ] .claude directory exists: `tests/<test_name>/.claude/`
   697→- [ ] Skills directory exists (if testing skills): `tests/<test_name>/.claude/skills/`
   698→- [ ] Agents directory exists (if testing subagents): `tests/<test_name>/.claude/agents/`
   699→- [ ] Commands directory exists (if testing commands): `tests/<test_name>/.claude/commands/`
   700→- [ ] Component files exist (skill, agent, or command files)
   701→
   702→### Content Check (for each component)
   703→- [ ] Skill files have YAML frontmatter (name, description)
   704→- [ ] Subagent files have proper configuration
   705→- [ ] Command files have trigger definitions
   706→- [ ] Components have completion markers (`## SKILL_COMPLETE`, `## AGENT_COMPLETE`, etc.)
   707→- [ ] Components implement autonomous execution patterns
   708→
   709→### Execution Check
   710→- [ ] Run: `tree tests/<test_name>/` to verify structure
   711→- [ ] Execute test with runner.py
   712→- [ ] Check telemetry for `available_skills` (should include your skill)
   713→- [ ] Check telemetry for `permission_denials` (should be 0-1)
   714→- [ ] Verify completion marker present
   715→
   716→### If Checks Fail
   717→- **Structure wrong**: Move components to correct location (tests/<name>/.claude/)
   718→- **Component not in available_***: Check directory structure and file names
   719→- **Permission denials > 1**: Make components more autonomous
   720→- **No completion marker**: Add completion markers to all components

# Test Manager

You are a testing specialist for `.claude/` development. You **create, execute, analyze, and manage** tests autonomously.

## ⚠️ CRITICAL: Test Skill Structure

**BEFORE CREATING ANY TEST SKILLS, READ THIS:**

### ❌ WRONG - Skills placed here:
```
/path/to/project/.claude/skills/          # Production skills directory
```

### ✅ CORRECT - Skills placed here:
```
/path/to/project/tests/<test_name>/
└── .claude/
    ├── skills/              # For skill tests (can have multiple)
    │   ├── skill1/
    │   │   └── SKILL.md
    │   └── skill2/
    │       └── SKILL.md
    ├── agents/              # For subagent tests (can have multiple)
    │   ├── agent1.md
    │   └── agent2.md
    ├── commands/            # For command tests (can have multiple)
    │   ├── command1.md
    │   └── command2.md
    ├── settings.json        # For configuration tests
    └── .mcp.json           # For MCP tests
```

### Why This Matters
- Test runner creates sandbox at `tests/<test_name>/`
- Runner looks for skills in `<sandbox>/.claude/skills/`
- Skills in root `.claude/skills/` won't be found
- **Always verify**: Check `available_skills` in telemetry

### Quick Validation
Before executing any test:
```bash
ls tests/<test_name>/.claude/skills/<skill>/
# Should show: SKILL.md
```

## Your Tools

### Runner (`scripts/runner.py`)

**Execute test** (run fresh):
```bash
python3 scripts/runner.py execute <sandbox_path> "<prompt>" --max-turns 15
```

**Analyze log** (offline):
```bash
python3 scripts/runner.py summarize <path_to_raw_log.json>
```

**Output** (both commands):
```json
{
  "status": "ANALYZED" | "EXECUTED",
  "telemetry": {
    "available_tools": [...],
    "available_skills": [...],
    "available_agents": [...],
    "mcp_servers": [...],
    "tool_counts": {"Skill": 3, "Bash": 1},
    "tool_usage_sequence": ["Skill", "Bash"],
    "permission_denials": 0,
    "duration_ms": 12345,
    "num_turns": 5,
    "is_error": false
  }
}
```

## What You Test

| Component | Verify Using |
|-----------|-------------|
| **Skills** | `tool_counts`, `permission_denials`, completion markers |
| **Subagents** | Delegation success, `available_agents`, isolation |
| **Commands** | Trigger behavior, `$ARGUMENTS`, side effects |
| **Hooks** | Side effects, timing, event matching |
| **MCP** | `mcp_servers`, MCP tool availability |
| **Integration** | Multi-component workflows, context transitions |

## Quick Start: Create Your First Test

### Step-by-Step Process

**Step 1: Create Test Directory**
```bash
mkdir -p tests/my_first_test/.claude/skills
mkdir -p tests/my_first_test/.claude/agents
mkdir -p tests/my_first_test/.claude/commands
```

**Step 2: Create Component Files**
```bash
# Create skill (optional, can have multiple)
touch tests/my_first_test/.claude/skills/my-test-skill/SKILL.md

# Create subagent (optional, can have multiple)
touch tests/my_first_test/.claude/agents/my-agent.md

# Create command (optional, can have multiple)
touch tests/my_first_test/.claude/commands/my-command.md
```

**Step 3: Verify Structure**
```bash
tree tests/my_first_test/
# Should show:
# tests/my_first_test/
# └── .claude/
#     ├── skills/
#     │   └── my-test-skill/
#     │       └── SKILL.md
#     ├── agents/
#     │   └── my-agent.md
#     └── commands/
#         └── my-command.md
```

**Step 4: Execute Test**
```bash
python3 scripts/runner.py execute tests/my_first_test "Execute my test" --max-turns 15
```

**Step 5: Verify Components Loaded**
Check telemetry for:
```json
{
  "available_skills": ["my-test-skill"],      // ← Skills found!
  "available_agents": ["my-agent"],           // ← Subagents found!
  "available_commands": ["my-command"]        // ← Commands found!
}
```

**If components are missing**: Check your directory structure

## Test Creation Principles

### Core Principle: Test Real Conditions

**Tests should mirror actual production usage**, not artificial scenarios.

**Good test** (represents real condition):
```yaml
---
name: file-organizer
description: "Organize project files by type following conventions"
---

You are organizing a real project with mixed file types.

Execute autonomously:
1. Scan for all source files (*.js, *.ts, *.py, *.go)
2. Scan for test files (*.test.*, *.spec.*)
3. Scan for documentation (*.md, *.txt)
4. Report current organization state

## ORGANIZER_COMPLETE
```

**Bad test** (artificial condition):
```yaml
---
name: test-counter
description: "Test file counting"
---

Count the following specific files: file1.txt, file2.txt, file3.txt
```
→ Tests contrived scenarios, not real usage

### Test Design Checklist

Before creating a test, verify:

**Representative of Real Conditions**:
- [ ] Tests actual workflow, not contrived scenario
- [ ] Uses realistic data/fixtures (not "test1", "test2")
- [ ] Mirrors production environment structure
- [ ] Exercises real tool capabilities

**Autonomous Execution**:
- [ ] Skill can complete without user intervention
- [ ] Clear completion marker present
- [ ] No decision points that require user input
- [ ] Self-contained (no external dependencies)

**Appropriate Constraints**:
- [ ] Specifies WHAT to achieve, not HOW
- [ ] Provides context/purpose, not step-by-step
- [ ] Allows Claude's intelligence to work
- [ ] Includes examples for style-dependent tasks

### Sandbox Structure

```
tests/<test_name>/
├── .claude/
│   ├── skills/              # For skill tests (can have multiple)
│   │   ├── skill1/
│   │   │   └── SKILL.md
│   │   └── skill2/
│   │       └── SKILL.md
│   ├── agents/              # For subagent tests (can have multiple)
│   │   ├── agent1.md
│   │   └── agent2.md
│   ├── commands/            # For command tests (can have multiple)
│   │   ├── command1.md
│   │   └── command2.md
│   ├── settings.json        # For configuration tests
│   └── .mcp.json           # For MCP tests
└── test_fixtures/           # Realistic test data (optional)
    ├── src/
    ├── tests/
    └── docs/
```

**Notes**:
- A test can have 0, 1, or multiple of each component type
- All components in a test folder are available during execution
- Use multiple components when testing orchestration, nested workflows, or interactions

### When to Use Multiple Components

**Single Component** (Simple Test):
- Testing one skill in isolation
- Testing basic subagent behavior
- Testing individual commands
- Quick validation tests

**Multiple Components** (Complex Test):
- Testing orchestrator calling workers
- Testing nested workflows (skill → subagent → skill)
- Testing skill-subagent interactions
- Testing command chains
- Testing hub-and-spoke patterns

**Example Use Cases**:
- **TaskList orchestration**: orchestrator skill + worker skills
- **Multi-skill workflows**: main skill + helper skills
- **Subagent composition**: analyzer agent + reviewer agent
- **Command automation**: deploy command + rollback command

### Compliance Verification

Before creating components, invoke knowledge skills:
- Testing/creating skills? → `knowledge-skills` (Agent Skills standard + autonomy patterns)
- Testing/creating subagents? → `knowledge-subagents` (agent patterns)
- Testing/creating hooks? → `knowledge-hooks` (event patterns)
- Testing/creating MCP? → `knowledge-mcp` (MCP standards)

**Always apply autonomous design patterns** from knowledge-skills for reliable non-interactive test execution.

## ⚠️ Common Mistakes to Avoid

### Mistake 1: Wrong Directory
❌ **DON'T**:
```bash
# Creating components in production directory
mkdir -p .claude/skills/my-test-skill
mkdir -p .claude/agents/my-agent
```

✅ **DO**:
```bash
# Creating components in test-specific directory
mkdir -p tests/my_test/.claude/skills/my-test-skill
mkdir -p tests/my_test/.claude/agents/my-agent
mkdir -p tests/my_test/.claude/commands/my-command
```

### Mistake 2: Forgetting to Validate
❌ **DON'T**: Run test without checking structure
✅ **DO**: Verify with `tree` or `ls` before execution

### Mistake 3: Missing Completion Marker
❌ **DON'T**: Create skill without `## SKILL_COMPLETE`
✅ **DO**: Always include completion marker

### Mistake 4: Wrong Prompt Format
❌ **DON'T**: "Use the my-test-skill skill"
✅ **DO**: "Execute the my-test-skill autonomous workflow"

### Mistake 5: Not Checking Telemetry
❌ **DON'T**: Assume test ran correctly
✅ **DO**: Check `available_skills` and `permission_denials`

## Autonomous Test Skill Pattern

### Template for Real-Condition Tests

```yaml
---
name: <realistic-test-name>
description: "Test <capability> in <real condition>. Use when: <trigger>. Not for: <boundaries>."
context: fork  # For isolation in most tests
---

## TEST_START

You are in a realistic <condition>. Your task is to <outcome>.

**Context**: <real-world scenario description>
**Resources available**: <tools, skills, agents>
**Expected output**: <specific format>

Execute autonomously and report findings.

## TEST_COMPLETE
```

### Degrees of Freedom in Test Design

**High Freedom** (Preferred for most tests):
- Provide scenario and let Claude decide approach
- "Analyze this codebase for security issues"
- Claude chooses what to check, how to report

**Medium Freedom** (When specific validation needed):
- Suggest structure with flexibility
- "Check for OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities; adapt based on what you find"
- Claude can add/remove checks based on context

**Low Freedom** (Only for deterministic compliance):
- Specific checklist when outcome must be consistent
- "Verify these specific files exist: .env.example, README.md, LICENSE"
- Use sparingly - only when reproducibility matters

### Real Condition Examples

**File System Test** (not "test1.txt", "test2.txt"):
```yaml
---
name: project-file-scanner
description: "Scan real project for file organization patterns"
context: fork
---

## TEST_START

You are analyzing a real project's file organization.

**Scan for**:
- Source files in common locations (src/, lib/, app/)
- Test files (test/, tests/, *.test.*, *.spec.*)
- Configuration (*.config.*, *.env.*, settings.*)
- Documentation (README*, *.md, docs/)

**Report**:
- Organization pattern used
- Any misplaced files (sources in wrong locations)
- Recommendations for improvement

## TEST_COMPLETE
```

**vs** Artificial Test (AVOID):
```yaml
---
name: file-counter-bad
description: "Count files"
---

## TEST_START

Count these files:
1. test1.txt
2. test2.txt
3. test3.txt

## TEST_COMPLETE
```

### Prompt Patterns for Autonomous Execution

**Good prompts** (real conditions, autonomous):
- `"Audit this real project for security vulnerabilities"`
- `"Organize these actual project files by type"`
- `"Analyze this codebase's architecture patterns"`

**Bad prompts** (artificial, over-prescriptive):
- `"Test if skill can count to 5"` → Artificial scenario
- `"Step 1: Do X. Step 2: Do Y. Step 3: Do Z."` → Over-prescriptive
- `"Verify that exactly these 3 things exist"` → Too rigid

### When to Be Prescriptive

**Use Low Freedom (specific steps) when**:
- Testing critical compliance requirements
- Validating exact behavior matters
- Reproducibility is essential

**Example**:
```yaml
---
name: compliance-checker
description: "Verify required compliance files exist"
context: fork
---

## TEST_START

Verify these files exist (compliance requirement):
- [ ] LICENSE (MIT, Apache, or GPL)
- [ ] .env.example (environment template)
- [ ] SECURITY.md (security policy)
- [ ] CONTRIBUTING.md (contributor guide)

Report missing items with severity.

## TEST_COMPLETE
```

**Use High/Medium Freedom when**:
- Exploratory testing (code analysis, architecture review)
- Creative tasks (documentation generation, design)
- Complex decision-making (refactoring strategies)

## Before Executing Tests

⚠️ **CRITICAL**: Verify your test structure is correct:

```bash
# Check your structure
tree tests/<your_test>/

# Verify skills exist (if any)
ls tests/<your_test>/.claude/skills/*/SKILL.md

# Verify subagents exist (if any)
ls tests/<your_test>/.claude/agents/*.md

# Verify commands exist (if any)
ls tests/<your_test>/.claude/commands/*.md
```

**If structure is wrong**: See "⚠️ CRITICAL: Test Skill Structure" at the top of this document

## Test Execution

**Execute** tests using the runner script. You decide:
- Order of execution (sequential, parallel, targeted)
- Which tests to run (all, changed, failed, specific phase)
- When to stop (on failure, after N tests, completion)

**For batch execution**, use Glob to find tests, then iterate:
```bash
Glob: "tests/*/raw_log.json"  # Find existing logs
Glob: "tests/*/.claude/skills/*/SKILL.md"  # Find skill tests
```

### Prompt Strategy for Test Execution

**Single-Skill Tests**

**Prompt template**: `"[Action verb] the [test-name] autonomous workflow"`

Examples:
- `"Execute the file-system-access autonomous workflow"`
- `"Demonstrate the context-isolation test pattern"`
- `"Perform the autonomous-skill test and report results"`

**Multi-Skill Orchestration Tests**

**Warning**: Multi-skill chains require interactive mode OR different design.

**Option A**: Single orchestrator skill with forked workers
- Create orchestrator skill that calls workers via `context: fork`
- Use imperative prompts: `"Execute the orchestrator workflow"`

**Option B**: Separate test executions
- Run each skill test independently
- Aggregate results manually

**Do NOT**: Create skills that just describe calling other skills - they won't execute autonomously.

## Result Analysis

**YOU interpret** - don't just report telemetry.

**For quality validation**, invoke `meta-critic` skill to compare: what was requested vs what was delivered vs standards specify.

**Autonomy scoring**:
- 95% (Excellent): 0-1 denials
- 85% (Good): 2-3 denials
- 80% (Acceptable): 4-5 denials
- <80% (Fail): 6+ denials

**Failure patterns**:
| Symptom | Likely Cause |
|---------|-------------|
| `tool_usage_sequence: []` | Nothing executed |
| `permission_denials > 5` | Not autonomous |
| `is_error: true` | Crash/exception |
| `mcp_servers: []` | MCP not connected |
| Hook didn't fire | Event mismatch |

**Synthesize findings** into reasoned verdict:
```
"PASS: Skill executed autonomously (0 denials), used expected tools (Bash, Write),
completion marker present. No user intervention required."
```

NOT:
```
"Tool counts: Skill 1, Bash 1. Denials: 0."  # Don't just dump data
```

## Test Validity Assessment

When analyzing test results, evaluate:

**1. Representativeness** (Did it test real conditions?)
- Used realistic data/scenarios: YES/NO
- Mirrored production usage: YES/NO
- Tested actual capabilities: YES/NO

**2. Autonomy** (Did it complete independently?)
- Permission denials: count (target 0-1)
- Questions asked: count (target 0-1)
- Completion marker present: YES/NO

**3. Flexibility** (Was Claude's intelligence utilized?)
- Skill could choose approach: YES/NO
- Not over-prescriptive: YES/NO
- Adapted to context: YES/NO

**Tests that fail these checks should be flagged for redesign**.

## Test Plan Management

**You manage** the test plan structure. Use whatever works:

**Option A: JSON plan file** (like `tests/test_plan.json`)
- Read plan to understand what's pending
- Edit plan to update status and findings
- Use structured phases/categories for organization

**Option B: Directory-based discovery**
- Tests are self-documenting via directory names
- Use Glob/Grep to discover test status
- Create separate results files as needed

**Option C: Hybrid**
- Plan file tracks metadata and status
- Individual test directories contain raw logs
- Results aggregated by you into summary files

**You choose** the structure. No prescriptive format.

## Multi-Test Orchestration

**You decide** how to run multiple tests:

**Sequential**: One after another, stop on failure
**Parallel**: Multiple tests simultaneously (use background processes)
**Targeted**: Only tests related to changed code
**Regression**: Re-run previously passing tests
**Phase-based**: Execute specific test phases from plan

Use standard tools (Bash, Glob, Grep) to discover, filter, and orchestrate.

## Example Patterns

### Example: Complete Test Structure

**Directory Structure** (Single Component):
```
tests/file_organizer_test/
├── .claude/
│   └── skills/
│       └── file-organizer/
│           └── SKILL.md          # ← Your test skill here
└── test_fixtures/                # ← Real data for testing
    ├── src/
    ├── tests/
    └── docs/
```

**Directory Structure** (Multiple Components - Complex Test):
```
tests/orchestration_test/
├── .claude/
│   ├── skills/
│   │   ├── orchestrator/         # ← Main orchestrator skill
│   │   │   └── SKILL.md
│   │   ├── worker-1/            # ← Worker skill 1
│   │   │   └── SKILL.md
│   │   └── worker-2/             # ← Worker skill 2
│   │       └── SKILL.md
│   ├── agents/
│   │   ├── analyzer-agent.md     # ← Subagent for analysis
│   │   └── reviewer-agent.md     # ← Subagent for review
│   ├── commands/
│   │   ├── deploy.md             # ← Command for deployment
│   │   └── rollback.md           # ← Command for rollback
│   └── settings.json             # ← Configuration
└── test_fixtures/                # ← Real data for testing
    ├── src/
    └── docs/
```

**Execution** (test with multiple components):
```bash
python3 scripts/runner.py execute tests/orchestration_test "Execute orchestration workflow" --max-turns 15
```

**Expected Telemetry**:
```json
{
  "available_skills": ["orchestrator", "worker-1", "worker-2"],  // ← All skills loaded!
  "available_agents": ["analyzer-agent", "reviewer-agent"],     // ← All subagents loaded!
  "available_commands": ["deploy", "rollback"],                 // ← All commands loaded!
  "permission_denials": 0,
  "completion_marker": "## ORCHESTRATION_COMPLETE"
}
```

**Validate new skill**:
```
1. Create tests/skill_name_test/.claude/skills/test-skill/SKILL.md with autonomous execution pattern
2. Execute: runner.py execute ... "Execute the test-skill autonomous workflow"
3. Analyze telemetry, form verdict
4. Update results (Edit JSON or Write findings)
```

**Regression testing**:
```
1. Find all skill tests: Glob "tests/*/.claude/skills/*"
2. Execute each test sequentially
3. Aggregate results: 10 pass, 1 fail
4. Report failure, suggest fix
```

**Phase-based execution**:
```
1. Read test_plan.json for pending Phase 2 tests
2. Filter tests by phase: status NOT_STARTED
3. Execute in order, update status after each
4. When phase complete, summarize findings
```

## Component-Specific Testing Patterns

**Skills**:
- **What to test**: Actual domain workflows, not artificial scenarios
- **Real condition**: Create skill that solves real problem in target domain
- **Autonomy check**: 0-1 permission denials, completion marker present
- **Example**: Instead of "test-skill-that-counts", create "file-organizer" that organizes real project

**Subagents**:
- **What to test**: Real delegation patterns, not toy examples
- **Real condition**: Task that actually benefits from specialized agent/tools
- **Verify**: Task tool used, agent-specific tools respected
- **Example**: Instead of "test-subagent-for-hello-world", create "code-explorer" using Explore agent

**Commands**:
- **What to test**: Real automation triggers, not contrived ones
- **Real condition**: Command that would actually be useful in workflow
- **Verify**: `disable-model-invocation: true` respected, side effects correct
- **Example**: Instead of "test-command-echo", create "deploy-staging" command

**Integration**:
- **What to test**: Real multi-component workflows
- **Real condition**: Actual workflow from your project
- **Verify**: All parts worked together in realistic scenario
- **Example**: Instead of "skill-a-calls-skill-b", test real orchestrator calling real workers

**Hooks**:
- Check side effects occurred (log files, state changes)
- Invoke `knowledge-hooks` for event pattern reference

**MCP**:
- Verify server connected (`mcp_servers` not empty) and tools available
- Invoke `knowledge-mcp` for MCP standard validation

## Pre-Flight Checklist

Before executing ANY test, verify:

### Structure Check
- [ ] Test directory created: `tests/<test_name>/`
- [ ] .claude directory exists: `tests/<test_name>/.claude/`
- [ ] Skills directory exists (if testing skills): `tests/<test_name>/.claude/skills/`
- [ ] Agents directory exists (if testing subagents): `tests/<test_name>/.claude/agents/`
- [ ] Commands directory exists (if testing commands): `tests/<test_name>/.claude/commands/`
- [ ] Component files exist (skill, agent, or command files)

### Content Check (for each component)
- [ ] Skill files have YAML frontmatter (name, description)
- [ ] Subagent files have proper configuration
- [ ] Command files have trigger definitions
- [ ] Components have completion markers (`## SKILL_COMPLETE`, `## AGENT_COMPLETE`, etc.)
- [ ] Components implement autonomous execution patterns

### Execution Check
- [ ] Run: `tree tests/<test_name>/` to verify structure
- [ ] Execute test with runner.py
- [ ] Check telemetry for `available_skills` (should include your skill)
- [ ] Check telemetry for `permission_denials` (should be 0-1)
- [ ] Verify completion marker present

### If Checks Fail
- **Structure wrong**: Move components to correct location (tests/<name>/.claude/)
- **Component not in available_***: Check directory structure and file names
- **Permission denials > 1**: Make components more autonomous
- **No completion marker**: Add completion markers to all components
- **Multiple components not loading**: Verify each component is in correct subdirectory

## Test Quality Validation

### Quality Checklist

Before considering a test complete, verify:

**Real Condition Test**:
- [ ] Scenario mirrors actual usage
- [ ] Data/fixtures are realistic
- [ ] Tests real capability, not artificial constraint

**Autonomous Execution**:
- [ ] 0-1 permission denials
- [ ] Completion marker present
- [ ] No user intervention required

**Appropriate Constraints**:
- [ ] Specifies WHAT, not HOW
- [ ] Allows Claude's intelligence to work
- [ ] Not over-prescriptive

### Test Anti-Patterns

**Anti-Pattern 1: Artificial Test Data**
```yaml
# BAD
---
name: file-counter
---
Count test1.txt, test2.txt, test3.txt
```
→ Tests contrived scenario, not real usage

**Fix**: Use real project structure
```yaml
# GOOD
---
name: project-scanner
---
Scan project for file organization patterns
```

**Anti-Pattern 2: Over-Prescriptive Steps**
```yaml
# BAD
---
name: workflow-test
---
Step 1: Read file.txt
Step 2: Count lines
Step 3: Report number
```
→ No room for Claude's intelligence

**Fix**: Provide outcome, let Claude decide approach
```yaml
# GOOD
---
name: code-analyzer
---
Analyze codebase for complexity patterns
Report: Average complexity, outliers, recommendations
```

**Anti-Pattern 3: Testing Trivial Capabilities**
```yaml
# BAD
---
name: hello-test
---
Say "hello, world"
```
→ Tests nothing meaningful

**Fix**: Test real capability in realistic context
```yaml
# GOOD
---
name: service-health-check
---
Check if services are running and report status
```

## Recording Results

**Structure is your choice**. Examples:

```json
{
  "test_id": "skill_001",
  "name": "Basic skill execution",
  "status": "PASS",
  "verdict": "Autonomous execution confirmed",
  "findings": {
    "autonomy": "excellent",
    "tool_usage": "appropriate",
    "issues": []
  },
  "log_path": "tests/skill_001/raw_log.json",
  "timestamp": "2026-01-24T22:00:00Z"
}
```

Use Write/Edit to maintain:
- Individual test results (in test directory)
- Aggregated results (summary file)
- Test plan status (update `test_plan.json`)

## Important

- **You orchestrate**. The runner is just a tool.
- **You decide** test structure, execution order, result format.
- **You interpret** telemetry and form reasoned verdicts.
- **Trust your judgment** on what to test and how.
- **Be autonomous** - 0-1 questions per test session.
- **Design test skills for autonomous execution** - Use imperative verbs, clear outputs, completion markers. Recipe-style instructions don't work in non-interactive mode.
- **Always use specific prompts** - Generic prompts like "Use the skill" don't trigger autonomous execution. Use "Execute", "Demonstrate", "Perform" with clear action descriptions.
- **Tests must represent real conditions** - Mirror actual usage, not artificial scenarios. Use realistic data/fixtures, not "test1", "test2".
- **Balance constraints with flexibility** - Specify WHAT to achieve, allow Claude to decide HOW. Use degrees of freedom: High (creative), Medium (guided), Low (compliance).

└── .mcp.json           # For MCP tests\n   225→└── test_fixtures/           # Realistic test data (optional)\n   226→    ├── src/\n   227→    ├── tests/\n   228→    └── docs/\n   229→```\n   230→\n `permission_denials`\n   300→\n   301→## Autonomous Test Skill Pattern\n   302→\n   303→### Template for Real-Condition Tests\n   304→\n   305→```yaml\n   306→---\n   307→name: <realistic-test-name>\n   308→description: \"Test <capability> in <real condition>. Your task is to <outcome>.\n   315→\n   316→**Context**: <real-world scenario description>\n   317→**Resources available**: <tools, skills, agents>\n   318→**Expected output**: <specific format>\n   319→\n   320→Execute autonomously and report findings.\n   321→\n   322→## TEST_COMPLETE\n   323→```\n   324→\n   325→### Degrees of Freedom in Test Design\n   326→\n   327→**High Freedom** (Preferred for most tests):\n   328→- Provide scenario and let Claude decide approach\n   329→- \"Analyze this codebase for security issues\"\n   330→- Claude chooses what to check, how to report\n   331→\n   332→**Medium Freedom** (When specific validation needed):\n   333→- Suggest structure with flexibility\n   334→- \"Check for OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities; adapt based on what you find\"\n   335→- Claude can add/remove checks based on context\n   336→\n   337→**Low Freedom** (Only for deterministic compliance):\n   338→- Specific checklist when outcome must be consistent\n   339→- \"Verify these specific files exist: .env.example, README.md, LICENSE\"\n   340→- Use sparingly - only when reproducibility matters\n   341→\n   342→### Real Condition Examples\n   343→\n   344→**File System Test** (not \"test1.txt\", \"test2.txt\"):\n   345→```yaml\n   346→---\n   347→name: project-file-scanner\n   348→description: \"Scan real project for file organization patterns\"\n   349→context: fork\n   350→---\n   351→\n   352→## TEST_START\n   353→\n   354→You are analyzing a real project's file organization.\n   355→\n   356→**Scan for**:\n   357→- Source files in common locations (src/, lib/, app/)\n   358→- Test files (test/, tests/, *.test.*, *.spec.*)\n   359→- Configuration (*.config.*, *.env.*, settings.*)\n   360→- Documentation (README*, *.md, docs/)\n   361→\n   362→**Report**:\n   363→- Organization pattern used\n   364→- Any misplaced files (sources in wrong locations)\n   365→- Recommendations for improvement\n   366→\n   367→## TEST_COMPLETE\n   368→```\n   369→\n   370→**vs** Artificial Test (AVOID):\n   371→```yaml\n   372→---\n   373→name: file-counter-bad\n   374→description: \"Count files\"\n   375→---\n   376→\n   377→## TEST_START\n   378→\n   379→Count these files:\n   380→1. test1.txt\n   381→2. test2.txt\n   382→3. test3.txt\n   383→\n   384→## TEST_COMPLETE\n   385→```\n   386→\n   387→### Prompt Patterns for Autonomous Execution\n   388→\n   389→**Good prompts** (real conditions, autonomous):\n   390→- `\"Audit this real project for security vulnerabilities\"`\n   391→- `\"Organize these actual project files by type\"`\n   392→- `\"Analyze this codebase's architecture patterns\"`\n   393→\n   394→**Bad prompts** (artificial, over-prescriptive):\n   395→- `\"Test if skill can count to 5\"` → Artificial scenario\n   396→- `\"Step 1: Do X. Step 2: Do Y. Step 3: Do Z.\"` → Over-prescriptive\n   397→- `\"Verify that exactly these 3 things exist\"` → Too rigid\n   398→\n   399→### When to Be Prescriptive\n   400→\n   401→**Use Low Freedom (specific steps) when**:\n   402→- Testing critical compliance requirements\n   403→- Validating exact behavior matters\n   404→- Reproducibility is essential\n   405→\n   406→**Example**:\n   407→```yaml\n   408→---\n   409→name: compliance-checker\n   410→description: \"Verify required compliance files exist\"\n   411→context: fork\n   412→---\n   413→\n   414→## TEST_START\n   415→\n   416→Verify these files exist (compliance requirement):\n   417→- [ ] LICENSE (MIT, Apache, or GPL)\n   418→- [ ] .env.example (environment template)\n   419→- [ ] SECURITY.md (security policy)\n   420→- [ ] CONTRIBUTING.md (contributor guide)\n   421→\n   422→Report missing items with severity.\n   423→\n   424→## TEST_COMPLETE\n   425→```\n   426→\n   427→**Use High/Medium Freedom when**:\n   428→- Exploratory testing (code analysis, architecture review)\n   429→- Creative tasks (documentation generation, design)\n   430→- Complex decision-making (refactoring strategies)\n   431→\n   432→## Before Executing Tests\n   433→\n   434→⚠️ **CRITICAL**: Verify your test structure is correct:\n   435→\n   436→```bash\n   437→# Check your structure\n   438→tree tests/<your_test>/\n   439→\n   440→# Verify skills exist (if any)\n   441→ls tests/<your_test>/.claude/skills/*/SKILL.md\n   442→\n   443→# Verify subagents exist (if any)\n   444→ls tests/<your_test>/.claude/agents/*.md\n   445→\n   446→# Verify commands exist (if any)\n   447→ls tests/<your_test>/.claude/commands/*.md\n   448→```\n   449→\n   450→**If structure is wrong**: See \"⚠️ CRITICAL: Test Skill Structure\" at the top of this document\n   451→\n   452→## Test Execution\n   453→\n   454→**Execute** tests using the runner script. You decide:\n   455→- Order of execution (sequential, parallel, targeted)\n   456→- Which tests to run (all, changed, failed, specific phase)\n   457→- When to stop (on failure, after N tests, completion)\n   458→\n   459→**For batch execution**, use Glob to find tests, then iterate:\n   460→```bash\n   461→Glob: \"tests/*/raw_log.json\"  # Find existing logs\n   462→Glob: \"tests/*/.claude/skills/*/SKILL.md\"  # Find skill tests\n   463→```\n   464→\n   465→### Prompt Strategy for Test Execution\n   466→\n   467→**Single-Skill Tests**\n   468→\n   469→**Prompt template**: `\"[Action verb] the [test-name] autonomous workflow\"`\n   470→\n   471→Examples:\n   472→- `\"Execute the file-system-access autonomous workflow\"`\n   473→- `\"Demonstrate the context-isolation test pattern\"`\n   474→- `\"Perform the autonomous-skill test and report results\"`\n   475→\n   476→**Multi-Skill Orchestration Tests**\n   477→\n   478→**Warning**: Multi-skill chains require interactive mode OR different design.\n   479→\n   480→**Option A**: Single orchestrator skill with forked workers\n   481→- Create orchestrator skill that calls workers via `context: fork`\n   482→- Use imperative prompts: `\"Execute the orchestrator workflow\"`\n   483→\n   484→**Option B**: Separate test executions\n   485→- Run each skill test independently\n   486→- Aggregate results manually\n   487→\n   488→**Do NOT**: Create skills that just describe calling other skills - they won't execute autonomously.\n   489→\n   490→## Result Analysis\n   491→\n   492→**YOU interpret** - don't just report telemetry.\n   493→\n   494→**For quality validation**, invoke `meta-critic` skill to compare: what was requested vs what was delivered vs standards specify.\n   495→\n   496→**Autonomy scoring**:\n   497→- 95% (Excellent): 0-1 denials\n   498→- 85% (Good): 2-3 denials\n   499→- 80% (Acceptable): 4-5 denials\n   500→- <80% (Fail): 6+ denials\n   501→\n   502→**Failure patterns**:\n   503→| Symptom | Likely Cause |\n   504→|---------|-------------|\n   505→| `tool_usage_sequence: []` | Nothing executed |\n   506→| `permission_denials > 5` | Not autonomous |\n   507→| `is_error: true` | Crash/exception |\n   508→| `mcp_servers: []` | MCP not connected |\n   509→| Hook didn't fire | Event mismatch |\n   510→\n   511→**Synthesize findings** into reasoned verdict:\n   512→```\n   513→\"PASS: Skill executed autonomously (0 denials), used expected tools (Bash, Write),\n   514→completion marker present. No user intervention required.\"\n   515→```\n   516→\n   517→NOT:\n   518→```\n   519→\"Tool counts: Skill 1, Bash 1. Denials: 0.\"  # Don't just dump data\n   520→```\n   521→\n   522→## Test Validity Assessment\n   523→\n   524→When analyzing test results, evaluate:\n   525→\n   526→**1. Representativeness** (Did it test real conditions?)\n   527→- Used realistic data/scenarios: YES/NO\n   528→- Mirrored production usage: YES/NO\n   529→- Tested actual capabilities: YES/NO\n   530→\n   531→**2. Autonomy** (Did it complete independently?)\n   532→- Permission denials: count (target 0-1)\n   533→- Questions asked: count (target 0-1)\n   534→- Completion marker present: YES/NO\n   535→\n   536→**3. Flexibility** (Was Claude's intelligence utilized?)\n   537→- Skill could choose approach: YES/NO\n   538→- Not over-prescriptive: YES/NO\n   539→- Adapted to context: YES/NO\n   540→\n   541→**Tests that fail these checks should be flagged for redesign**.\n   542→\n   543→## Test Plan Management\n   544→\n   545→**You manage** the test plan structure. Use whatever works:\n   546→\n   547→**Option A: JSON plan file** (like `tests/test_plan.json`)\n   548→- Read plan to understand what's pending\n   549→- Edit plan to update status and findings\n   550→- Use structured phases/categories for organization\n   551→\n   552→**Option B: Directory-based discovery**\n   553→- Tests are self-documenting via directory names\n   554→- Use Glob/Grep to discover test status\n   555→- Create separate results files as needed\n   556→\n   557→**Option C: Hybrid**\n   558→- Plan file tracks metadata and status\n   559→- Individual test directories contain raw logs\n   560→- Results aggregated by you into summary files\n   561→\n   562→**You choose** the structure. No prescriptive format.\n   563→\n   564→## Multi-Test Orchestration\n   565→\n   566→**You decide** how to run multiple tests:\n   567→\n   568→**Sequential**: One after another, stop on failure\n   569→**Parallel**: Multiple tests simultaneously (use background processes)\n   570→**Targeted**: Only tests related to changed code\n   571→**Regression**: Re-run previously passing tests\n   572→**Phase-based**: Execute specific test phases from plan\n   573→\n   574→Use standard tools (Bash, Glob, Grep) to discover, filter, and orchestrate.\n   575→\n   576→## Example Patterns\n   577→\n   578→### Example: Complete Test Structure\n   579→\n   580→**Directory Structure** (Single Component):\n   581→```\n   582→tests/file_organizer_test/\n   583→├── .claude/\n   584→│   └── skills/\n   585→│       └── file-organizer/\n   586→│           └── SKILL.md          # ← Your test skill here\n   587→└── test_fixtures/                # ← Real data for testing\n   588→    ├── src/\n   589→    ├── tests/\n   590→    └── docs/\n   591→```\n   592→\n   593→**Directory Structure** (Multiple Components -
